events.originalText: Christ Mocked (pictured) by Cimabue sold at auction in France for €19.5 million, a record for a pre-1500 artwork.
events.subtitle: Mocking of Jesus
events.headline: Cimabue's Christ Mocked Painting Sells for Record €19.5 Million in France Auction

events.originalText: Michael D. Higgins was elected President of Ireland with far more votes than any politician in the country's history.
events.subtitle: Michael D. Higgins
events.headline: Michael D. Higgins Elected President of Ireland in Historic Landslide Victory

events.originalText: The Boston Red Sox completed a sweep of the St. Louis Cardinals to win the 2004 World Series, breaking the so-called "Curse of the Bambino".
events.subtitle: Boston Red Sox
events.headline: Boston Red Sox Break Curse of the Bambino, Win 2004 World Series

events.originalText: Armed men led by Nairi Hunanyan carried out a mass shooting at the Armenian parliament, killing Prime Minister Vazgen Sargsyan (pictured), National Assembly speaker Karen Demirchyan, and six others.
events.subtitle: Nairi Hunanyan
events.headline: Armenian Prime Minister Vazgen Sargsyan Killed in Mass Shooting at Parliament

events.originalText: Widerøe Flight 744 suffered a controlled flight into terrain while on approach to Namsos Airport, Norway, killing two crew members and four passengers.
events.subtitle: Widerøe Flight 744
events.headline: Widerøe Flight 744 Crashes in Controlled Flight into Terrain, Killing Six

events.originalText: U.S. Navy Petty Officer Allen R. Schindler Jr. was killed in Sasebo, Japan, for being gay, which led to the U.S. Armed Forces' "don't ask, don't tell" policy.
events.subtitle: Petty officer third class
events.headline: U.S. Navy Officer Allen R. Schindler Jr. Killed in Japan for Being Gay

events.originalText: American Catholic priest Philip Berrigan led a protest against the Vietnam War by pouring blood over Selective Service records in Baltimore, Maryland.
events.subtitle: Philip Berrigan
events.headline: Protest Against Vietnam War Led by Priest Philip Berrigan in Baltimore

events.originalText: Inter-religious riots in which Hindu mobs targeted Muslim families began in the Indian state of Bihar, resulting in 2,000 to 30,000 deaths.
events.subtitle: 1946 Bihar riots
events.headline: Inter-religious Riots in Bihar, India, Result in Thousands of Deaths

events.originalText: World War II: The Imperial Japanese Navy achieved a pyrrhic victory against the United States at the Battle of the Santa Cruz Islands.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Imperial Japanese Navy Victorious at Battle of Santa Cruz Islands in WWII

events.originalText: World War I: The Royal Navy dreadnought HMS Audacious was sunk by a mine, but its loss was kept secret for four years.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: Royal Navy Dreadnought HMS Audacious Sunk by Mine in WWI

events.originalText: The first underground segment of the New York City Subway opened, connecting New York City Hall (station pictured) with Harlem.
events.subtitle: Early history of the IRT subway
events.headline: First Underground Segment of NYC Subway Opens, Connecting City Hall with Harlem
